Job Title: Procurement Capability Manager (open to remote)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Information Technology, Sales

Description:
At Hasbro we’re changing the face of play and entertainment. We’re looking for people who want to explore, experiment and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of community, passion, integrity, creativity and inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative and highly committed individuals for 100+ years and we believe the best is yet to come.

At Hasbro we’re changing the face of play and entertainment. We’re looking for people who want to explore, experiment, and innovate to come up with the best ideas. Our culture of community, passion, integrity, creativity, and inclusion has inspired our diverse team of highly skilled, highly creative, and highly committed individuals for 100 years and we believe the best if yet to come.

We are seeking to add a Procurement Capability Manager to play an integral role in our Global Sourcing Organization! The role will support the Head of the Sourcing COE with the design, deployment, and adoption of a formal Strategic Category Management program. In addition, it will provide ongoing support for procurement processes via relevant tools and training to achieve excellence in the areas of spend analysis, sourcing, contract management, and supplier relationship management. The jobholder works closely with the Category Sourcing Leaders in the development and operationalization of their category sourcing strategies of the various product and material categories.

A day in the life of a Procurement Capability Manager:

Under leadership of the Head of Sourcing COE, deploy and operationalize Best-in-Class procurement processes.Lead transformation initiatives to drive a step-change in sourcing productivity, supplier performance, and report results.Support the development and implementation of the sourcing technology strategy & roadmap.Implement knowledge retention initiatives (e.g., best practices, process manuals, standard contracts/T&C’s, price benchmarks, RFx templates, cost models) across the Sourcing organization.Develop and implement KPI/metrics working closely with IT & Finance on common definitions and manage monthly, quarterly, and yearly scorecards that track procurement and supplier performance.

What you’ll bring:

Master’s degree or significant relevant experience in a related discipline such as Procurement, Supply Chain or Engineering.Proven experience in procurement or a closely related field preferably in fast moving consumer goods.A procurement expert with a passion for developing best practices and teaching teams to perform at their best. Must be a proven change agent confident in ‘standing alone’ and embedding sophisticated and advanced processes.Must have the ability to think on the fly while drawing on procurement experience to provide real life examples and theory to problems or questions from groups of experienced procurement professionals. Ability to develop a rigorous and consistent methodology and training program that can flex to global and cultural nuances.Extensive project management experience with the vision to develop, deploy, adjust, and embed a comprehensive strategic sourcing methodology that will transform and upgrade the sourcing function for years to come. 

Hasbro’s world-class brands and talented people are our greatest assets. One of the ways we invest in you is through a competitive and contemporary benefits package. Your particular benefits package will depend on your position, location, local legal requirements and years with the company. Here’s a look at what your benefits package may include: Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance, Half-day Fridays year round, Paid Vacation Time & Holidays, Generous 401(k) match, Paid Parental Leave, Team Hasbro Volunteer Program, Employee Giving & Matching Gifts Programs, Tuition Reimbursement, Toy Discounts and more!

Hasbro is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment. We are committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
